content: **important note ** this pattern is available in a tutorial video for free on my youtube channel 1 if you want the printable version grab your copy here the valentine hat is a beginner friendly stranded colorwork hat i m a beginner when it comes to colorwork so i walk you through the process in the video and there is an included colorwork chart as well as written instructions **materials** yarn - worsted weight * mc 98 yards 90 m * cc 25 yards 23 m *sample uses i love this yarn 100% acrylic - 355 yards 325 m / 199g in the colorways rosy cheeks mc and ivory cc * needles * us 8 5 00 mm 16″ 41 cm circumference *or size needed to match gauge * * you will also need a longer cord length or dpns for the crown decreases * rib needles 1-2 sizes smaller than gauge for the brim in 16 41 cm other materials yarn needle stitch markers gauge stockinette colorwork - worked in the round * 17 5 sts / 23 rounds = 4″ 10 cm *i worked the swatch in the colorwork pattern i found my plain stockinette stitch gauge was looser than the colorwork section it balanced out when working the colorwork for the swatch * sizing one size 20 5 52 cm around by 8 20 5 cm long this hat only has 0 5 1 5 cm of negative ease based on the average female head circumference this is to prevent the colorwork section from stretching and losing the design when you wear it note this pattern has not been tech edited or test knit the price reflects that 1 https //bit ly/valentinehatvideo
